com.samsung.android.service.health.tracking

Class HealthTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.service.health.tracking.HealthTracker

  • public class HealthTracker
extends Object
    HealthTracker enables an application to set an event listener and get tracking data for a speficic HealthTrackerType. 

      
 private final HealthTracker.TrackerEventListener mListener;
 HealthTracker ppgTracker = HealthTrackingService.getHealthTracker(HealthTrackerType.PPG_GREEN);
 ppgTracker.setEventListener(mListener);
 ppgTracker.unsetEventListener();

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HealthTracker.TrackerError
      Enums for errors that HealthTracker's event listener throws.
      static interface  HealthTracker.TrackerEventListener
      TrackerEventListener receives a sensor data event callback.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Flush data.

      Set an event listener to this HealthTracker instance.

      Set exercise data along with timestamp to get sweat loss.

    • Method Detail

      • setEventListener

        public void setEventListener(HealthTracker.TrackerEventListener listener)
        Set an event listener to this HealthTracker instance. If it succeeds, the event listener exists and retrieves sensor data until the unsetEventListener() call.

        Only 1 HealthTrackerType's event listener can be set in 1 application.
        Adding multiple event listeners for the same HealthTrackerType in 1 application is unavailable.

        Parameters:
        listener - An implemented TrackerEventListener.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setExerciseData

        public void setExerciseData(DataType type,
                            float[] data,
                            long[] timestamp)
        Set exercise data along with timestamp to get sweat loss.
        Parameters:
        type - A data type to set exercise data like DataType.STEP_PER_MINUTE.
        data - An array of exercise data corresponding to DataType.STEPS_PER_MINUTE in ExerciseUpdateListener.onExerciseUpdate().
        timestamp - An array of timestamp for each exercise data point.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the data array size is more than 200 or the data value is negative.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the timestamp array is not sorted or values are not in Epoch.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the timestamp values are earlier than starting the exercise.
        IllegalStateException - If it is called before setExerciseState(ExerciseState.START) is called.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setExerciseState

        public void setExerciseState(ExerciseState state)
        Set an exercise state.

        Setting ExerciseState.START again in the same application is ignored if the exercise was started already.
        If another application calls setExerciseState(ExerciseState.START), this application's exercise is terminated automatically and will get sweat loss data instantly. Then another application works normally.

        Parameters:
        state - An exercise state with ExerciseState. START and STOP work.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If it is called before setEventListener(com.samsung.android.service.health.tracking.HealthTracker.TrackerEventListener).
        IllegalStateException - If setExerciseState(ExerciseState.STOP) is called before setExerciseState(ExerciseState.START).
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • unsetEventListener

        public void unsetEventListener()
        Stop the registered event listener to this HealthTracker instance.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • flush

        public boolean flush()
        Flush data. It provides collected data instantly.
        Returns:
        true If it succeeded.
        false If it failed or no registered event listener.
        Since:
        1.0.0
